textString: HOWL'S MOVING CASTLE Miss Sophie, I've closed up the shop.
I wonder if Howl's in town.
No, just hiding from all the soldiers.
They say Howl tore her heart out.
Don't worry, he's not going to want yours.
Hey there little mouse, lost your way?
Then how about a cup of tea?
- No thank you, I'm busy - She sure is a cute little mouse.
See, it's those whiskers of yours.
She's even cuter when she's mad.
Why don't you two take a little walk?
No, really, I'm only going to Cesari's.
Wait here until the coast is clear.
- Let's go for a walk, Lettie.
How did you land on the veranda like that?
It feels like I'm in a dream...
Lettie, why not use the office?
Thanks, but I should really be working.
You sure he wasn't a wizard?
Don't tell me he's stolen your heart.
If that was the wizard Howl, he'd have eaten it right up.
Don't worry, Howl's only after beauties.
Listen to me, we live in dangerous times.
They say even the Witch of the Waste.
It's a relief to know you're doing well.
Listen, are you going to spend your whole life in that shop?
It meant so much to Papa.
Are you sure you want to be a hatter?
- Come by the shop next time.
Sophie, you've got to look out for yourself.
I thought I'd locked the door.
What a cheap shop, full of cheap little hats.
This is just a simple hat shop.
I think you had better leave.
You're very brave, taking on the Witch of the Waste.
You won't be able to tell anyone about that spell.
I'll be fine, I'll be fine.
It's all the rage in Kingsbury.
Hatter, Sophie hasn't come down to work yet I wonder what's the matter?
I don't want you to catch it.
You're still healthy, and these clothes finally suit you.
They're saying this war is going to be terrible...
Such a gentleman, but I'll manage.
Sure, old lady, but where are you off to?
Just a bit farther than where you're going.
Nothing but witches and wizards ahead.
Going to the Folding Valley, at this hour?
I've hardly made any progress at all.
Thank goodness I've still got my teeth.
Might be a bit too thick.
I thought you were working for the Witch.
But how do you stand by yourself?
At least you're not upside down anymore.
You don't owe me a thing.
You must be a magical whatever-you-are.
I've had enough of witches and spells!
Just go stand wherever you like!
This is a perfect cane Thank you kindly While you're at it, could you bring me a house to sleep in?
Seems you get more cunning with age.
I never realized how weak you feel when you get old.
This is hardly what I meant when I asked for shelter!
Are you going to let me on, or not!
It seems warm enough inside, Turnip.
Even Howl wouldn't want an ancient heart like mine.
You may be a turnip, but you're a good turnip May you find happiness.
Just looks like a dilapidated heap.
Well, one nice thing about getting old is that nothing surprises you anymore That's some spell you're under.
It won't be easy to break.
And you can't even tell anyone about it.
Well, then, Calcifer, can you break the spell I'm under?
Easy If you break the spell that chains me to this place, I'll break your spell in a flash.
In other words, bargain with a demon.
You sure you can keep that promise?
I'm chained here by a contract with Howl, who works me to death.
I'm the one who keeps this castle moving.
If you figure out the secret contract, the spell will break.
If you do that, I'll break your spell, too.
I've got my doubts about her.
His Majesty desires every wizard and magician, even the witches, to aid our homeland.
She wandered in from the Wastes.
You're not a witch, are you?
A witch could never get in.
Granny, are you a witch, too?
That's right, I'm the scariest witch in the land.
Sprinkle this powder on your ship and the winds will favor it.
I can't have you making up things.
You should give up that disguise.
It's not a disguise, it's magic.
Is this the residence of Wizard Pendragon?
I bear an invitation from His Majesty.
Please inform Master Pendragon that he is required at the Palace.
A city fit for a king Get back in or you'll lose your nose.
I'm going to get really mad.
This is a magic house, isn't it?
- Where does the black one lead?
But you've got bacon and eggs.
We can't use the fire when Master Howl's away.
That's right, I won't cook for you.
You'll do as I say, or I'll pour water on you.
Or would you rather I told Howl about our bargain?
I never should've let this old lady in.
That's right, there's a good fire.
You have letters from the king.
Not an easy thing to do.
You see, I'm your new cleaning lady.
Pass me two more bacon slices and six more eggs.
And who hired you to clean?
I've never seen such a filthy house.
You're all ganging up on me!
I've got my work cut out for me.
Brethren, let us partake of our daily bread.
Haven't had a real breakfast in a long while.
So, what's that in your pocket?
"He who catches a falling star, oh heartless man.
Well, so much for the tab.
The scorch mark has vanished, but not the spell.
- And send hot water to the bath.
Do you work for the Witch of the Waste?
Damn that Witch of the Waste!
Wait 'til I get my hands on her!
Bugs, you'd better scurry away or I'll sweep you out!
Every last one of you, mocking me!
I'll die without some fresh wood!
Try not to torment my friend.
Master Howl, are you going out?
Markl, tell our cleaning lady not to get too carried away.
If I die, Howl goes with me.
If I were you, I'd put your precious things away in a hurry.
My little outburst gave me back my strength.
You sure like being upside down.
The odd creature seems to have taken a liking to me.
Are you sure you're not a witch, Sophie?
That's right, I'm the cleanest witch in the land.
Turnip, don't pull it so tight.
Seems like he likes doing the wash.
Turnip must belong to the demons.
Calcifer doesn't seem to mind him.
You're right, maybe he's a demon of the dead.
But he led me to this wonderful place.
I've put away all the laundry, Sophie.
How mysterious, I've never felt such peace.
You reek of burnt flesh and steel.
Keep flying and one day you won't be able to change yourself back.
The country's ablaze, from the southern coast to the northern border.
I hate the fire in gunpowder.
They have no manners - My own kind attacked me.
They'll cry plenty later on, when they can't regain human form.
No, they'll just forget they ever knew how to cry.
Aren't you supposed to report to the king yourself?
Hot water for my bath Oh, no, not again.
Yeah, wasting my hot water again.
I'm sure Howl won't eat any breakfast.
It's lovely shopping in the morning.
Fish, all fresh off the boat.
Sophie, let's go get a closer look.
No, I've no stomach for such things.
Our most advanced battleship, reduced to this.
Markl, there are Blob Men nearby.
They work for the Witch of the Waste.
Don't people notice those terrible monsters?
A glass of water, please Sure.
Sophie, what did you do to the bathroom shelves?
My hair's turned this weird color!
You mixed up everything on the shelves and ruined the spells!
I didn't mix up anything, I simply cleaned up.
I told you not to get too carried away!
This new shade's quite lovely in its way.
What's the point in living, if you aren't beautiful?
He's calling on the spirits of Darkness.
He did this last time a girl ditched him.
You can just dye your hair again.
I've had enough of you, Howl!
I've had enough of this place!
Thank you, Turnip You're a kind scarecrow Please come back, Sophie.
Get that hot water running, Markl!
You look after him now, Markl.
I'll have to clean all over again.
The Witch of the Waste is searching for my house.
You're right, I saw her cronies down at the port.
The truth is, I'm a coward.
All this junk is just sorcery to keep her away.
Tell me, why is the Witch of the Waste after you?
She seemed quite interesting, so I approached her.
But she terrified me and I ran away.
Now the king's ordered me to report to him.
How many names do you use, Howl?
The oath I took at the Sorcery Academy.
Just say it to his face.
"Stop this foolish war I refuse to help you."
Sophie, you don't know what they're like.
A king thinks only of what's best for his people.
You'll go in my place, Sophie!
Just tell him your son is an idle good-for-nothing.
Maybe Madam Suliman will even give up on me.
After all the magic I spent making your dress pretty...
This charm assures your safe return.
Don't worry, I'll follow you in disguise.
I'm sure this will never work.
I don't suppose he's following me, disguised as a crow.
I'm sure Howl would pick a more dramatic disguise Not that...
The Palace is so far away.
Disguising yourself as an old dog, of all things.
Do you know how exhausting it is to be old?
Thank you so much for delivering my note to Howl.
Thanks to him, I've become a cleaning lady.
By the way, what brings you to see the king?
I'm sick of working for Howl.
It seems that idiot, Suliman, finally needs my power.
Why don't you break the spell you put on me?
My gifts lie in casting spells, not breaking them.
If you weren't here, I'd have hit her with my cane.
Madam, vehicles are prohibited beyond this point.
Using magic to force me to climb these stairs.
Heavy, why are you so heavy?
Suddenly remembered... how to break my spell?
Where does she get all that energy?
I have to put you down.
Why don't you call it a day?
It's been 50 years now, since they drove me out of here...
I've been longing for this day, ever since...
Still, I'm not nice enough to help you out.
Next time I'll turn you feeble, too!
We are forbidden to assist anyone.
But the king himself invited her.
And you call yourself a witch?
Madam Pendragon and the Witch of the Waste!
Isn't this what you've been waiting for?
Madam Pendragon and the Witch of the Waste!
That was the name of my hat shop.
I am Madam Suliman, His Majesty's witch.
I asked him to escort you.
You see, he sends his mother to make excuses.
I'm sure he'd be utterly useless to His Majesty.
A student of such marvelous gifts.
I rejoiced in finally finding a worthy heir.
But then, a demon stole his heart, and he abandoned me.
He turned his magic to purely selfish uses.
His power is too great for one with no heart.
If he follows that path he'll wind up like the Witch of the Waste.
I just restored her to her real age.
Once upon a time, she was a magnificent witch.
She made a bargain with a demon.
Who consumed her, body and soul, long, long ago.
Our kingdom can no longer afford to turn a blind eye to disreputable wizards and witches.
If Howl comes here to serve the kingdom, I will teach him how to break with the demon.
If not, I'll strip him of his powers as I have taken hers.
Now I understand why Howl refused to come here.
Forcing your aged guests to climb stairs, dragging them into strange rooms...
Yes, he's selfish and cowardly and unpredictable.
But he's straight as an arrow.
He only wants to be free.
Howl won't turn into an evil monster.
He'll battle the demon on his own.
I want Howl's heart, I want it!
Thank you for asking Meetings bore me.
I flew out for a breather.
I appreciate it, but I don't intend to win any war with magic.
It's true that Suliman's powers shield our palace from bombs.
But they just fall on neighboring towns.
This time, we'll beat them to a pulp.
Suliman, you've outdone yourself with that double.
Delighted to see you doing so well.
I've no wish to fight you.
Don't look down, you'll be dragged down.
It's time I showed your mother what you really are.
Oh, no, Sophie, you brought the whole gang along.
Oh, well, too late to toss you now.
Fly straight to the castle in the Wastes.
Don't worry, the ring will guide you.
Why send me to Suliman if you were coming yourself?
Your presence gave me the courage for it.
She's too terrible to face on my own.
I was in grave danger back there.
I can give you 5 minutes of invisibility, now's your chance.
That's the most fun I've had in ages.
I supposed Howl thinks he's escaped...
I don't know how to stop this thing!
Thank you for coming to meet us.
Oh, no, you've gone too far.
I want to break the spell you're under.
You can't even break your own spell!
Sophie, you'd better figure out how to break my spell quick.
We're both running out of time.
Meaning Howl will turn into a monster?
Calcifer, Suliman told me, Howl has given you something very precious.
And if I threaten to dump water over you?
They call it a castle, but once you get inside, it's a junk heap.
But, Sophie she's the Witch of the Waste.
- Master Howl, can we keep this puppy?
An old Witch and Madam Suliman's dog.
Why'd you let them in, Calcifer?
You're under quite a spell, too.
Seems everyone in our little family is complicated...
There aren't any shops, here in the middle of nowhere.
Madam Suliman can track us down in no time, here.
But you'll have to stay behind.
The magic in your spell's too risky.
I thought it would suit you.
Yes, it's perfect for a housekeeper.
I got you new clothes, too.
See that new color on the dial?
Did you make it with your magic?
Only a little, to help the flowers.
I feel I've been here before.
When I was little I spent my summers there alone.
My Uncle, the Wizard, left it to me in secret.
Make yourself at home there, Sophie.
I'm afraid you'll go off and disappear somewhere, once I'm inside.
I don't mind if you're a monster.
I want to make sure that you'll all live comfortably.
Why not a flower shop, with all these flowers?
You'd be good at it, Sophie.
I want to help you, Howl.
I'm not beautiful and I'm only good at cleaning...
The good thing about being old is that you've so little to lose...
On its way to burn cities and people.
Oops, looks like they're onto us.
I've had it with this place!
Don't worry about Master Howl, Sophie.
Sometimes, he's gone for days on end.
Men, why ever should we want them...
But a young man's heart is so delicious!
But best not go out tonight.
Suliman's creatures are searching high and low for our house.
What a good fire, hiding us so well Sophie, a stranger got in!
But, oh, look how you've aged!
Sophie, I've got a new husband!
We can all live together again.
You'll never have to clean again.
I'm so glad I found you again.
We'll really catch up next time.
In the meantime, you take care.
The oldest trick in the book, Suliman.
I've done what I was told.
Take me back to my husband.
Yes, I'm sure Madam Suliman will be pleased.
Do you wish to run, too?
That's what that lady spoke of...
I'll never let Suliman get hold of Howl.
But the paper says we won.
Why deny an old lady her pleasures.
Open the window, Markl I wouldn't open that now...
In Calcifer's present state, he can't possibly keep them out.
If you've energy to spare, put out the fires.
I had too many enemies, tonight.
Madam, was that a gift from Suliman?
That granny fed me something nasty!
I feel we need a nice long chat.
Another round of bombs is coming.
I've finally found someone I want to protect...
No, as long as we stay here, Howl will keep fighting.
Suliman will find us, right away!
At this rate, Howl will never make it back alive.
My contract says I can't leave the fireplace.
If you two can't solve this, I'll do it for you.
If I leave, the house will collapse.
Even I don't know what'll happen...
I told you, it would collapse.
Turnip, find us a way in.
Markl, we can get in here.
I told you, if we'd stayed put, Howl and I could've handled it.
I want to go to Howl.
I know you can do it.
As the saying goes, "The best blaze brightest in adversity".
Then, give me something of yours, Sophie.
Imagine what I could do with your eyes and your heart.
Oh, no, Heen, look what I've done.
What if I've killed Howl, too?
I promise I'll come back for you!
Wait for me in the future!
I'm sorry I took so long.
You've been waiting all this time.
You'd better take good care of it.
If I give Howl's heart back, will it kill you?
Probably not, if you do it, Sophie.
After all, we both survived the water you dumped on me.
It's all warm and fluttery like a little bird.
It's still only a child's heart.
May Calcifer live a thousand years, and may Howl recover his heart...
I'll get you a new stick, right away.
I'm a prince from the next kingdom.
A cruel spell turned me into a scarecrow.
A spell that only your beloved's kiss could break.
And if Sophie hadn't saved me, I would have died.
Like I'm trapped under a stone.
Oh, yes, a heart's a heavy burden.
Oh, Sophie, your hair is just like starlight.
So, now you see how Sophie feels.
You'd best go home and make them stop this war.
That's exactly what I shall do.
When the war is over, I shall return.
"A fickle heart is the only constant in this world."
My, you have a way with words I'll wait for your return, then Why should you contact me now?
What on earth have you been up to?
Bring the Prime Minister and the Minister of Defense.
Let's put an end to this foolish war.
You didn't have to come back.

Though we slipped apart Like sunlight through the leaves The promise of love Will live on eternally Even though I'm alone now My tomorrows are boundless Like the kindness you showed me Hidden in the night Somehow I lost you Among all my memories In a brook's gentle laughter In the scent of a flower In the depth of the sky You will live on eternally From the Novel By Diana Wynne Jones Music By Joe HISAISHI Theme Song Performed By Chieko BAISHO Production Studio Ghibli Producer Toshio SUZUKI Written and Directed By Hayao MIYAZAKI The End
